I think this may be overkill, today you can do this with Firebase.dynamicLinks(app).getDynamicLink(intent),
same for the Uri extensions.
wdyt?

@vkryachko The initial motivation for these functions was to improve readability the same way Android KTX does (e.g. "https://firebase.google.com".toUri() instead of Uri.parse("https://firebase.google.com"))
I then realized developers may want to use their own FirebaseApp instance, and passing it as argument seemed like the only way. But I now realize it totally defeats the initial "improved readability" purpose.
Maybe we should drop the extensions that take FirebaseApp as argument, but keep the ones with no arguments?
What do you say?

hm, it's hard to objectively judge the usefulness of "https://firebase.google.com".toUri(), I guess it is useful if it's included in android ktx.
One difference it has from your proposal though is that intent.getDynamicLink() returns a task indicating not a trivial transformation but some IO heave work. In this regard I would be hesitant to optimize for conciseness.
Additionally, in the case of the default app, Firebase.dynamicLinks.getDynamicLink(intent) does not look much less readable to me.
@vkryachko I totally understand your points. I'll remove these extensions and keep the destructuring declarations.
